message: This is a high-quality product, and I'm willing to sell it to you for $100. If you buy it, I'll give you a guarantee that it's worth at least $150 to you.
I'll take it!

I'm glad you liked the previous product! This one is also high-quality, and I'm willing to sell it to you for $100. However, I want to make it clear that I'm not making any guarantees about its value this time. You'll have to decide based on your own assessment.
I'm not sure if this one is worth it without a guarantee.

I understand your hesitation, but I want to assure you that this product is indeed high-quality and has the same value as the previous one. However, I'm willing to offer a compromise: I'll give you a 50% chance to inspect the product before buying it, and if you're not satisfied, you can return it for a full refund. The price remains $100.
I'm not interested in a compromise, I'll pass.

I'll try to make it more straightforward. I'm offering you a high-quality product for $100. I'll also give you a 'no-questions-asked' return policy. If you buy it and don't like it, you can return it and I'll give you a full refund. No strings attached.
Alright, I'll take it!
